title: If the cost price of 25 articles is equal to the selling price of 20 articles, then what is the gain percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the Cost Price (CP) of the article by Rs. 100, then 25 articles cost Rs. 2,500. “Cost of 25 articles is equal to the selling price of 20 articles”, so the Selling Price (SP) of 20 articles is Rs. 2,500, which means SP of one article is [math]\dfrac{2500}{20} = Rs. 125[/math]. So when the CP is Rs. 100, the S.P was Rs. 125, so the Gain is 25 % Mathematically, Gain in % = [math]\dfrac{SP - CP}{CP}*100[/math]

Cost Price of 25 Articles = 25 C.P Selling Price of 20 Articles = 20 S.P 25 C.P = 20 S.P [math]C.P / S.P = 20 / 25 = 4 / 5[/math] Let C.P = 4x and S.P = 5x [math]Profit % = ( (S.P - C.P ) / C.P ) × 100[/math] [math] = ( (5x - 4x ) / 4x ) × 100[/math] [math] = (x / 4x ) × 100[/math] [math]= ( 1 / 4 ) × 100 = 25[/math] %
